entry.title: Combined summary - Voting (BIP-100) Question, Etc.
entry.summary: The author of the message is seeking information on how miners would vote on BIP 100, assuming it becomes a viable option. They reference a post on Bitcoin Stack Exchange for some information, but are unclear on when miners would take action. Miners are voting on BIP 100 and the BIP will be submitted with implementation in the next two weeks. The voting process for miners is somewhat unclear, but a Bitcoin Stack Exchange post provides some information.Additionally, the author poses a follow-up question about when BIP 100 will be published and moved to 'accepted' status on GitHub. The email comes from odinn via bitcoin-dev and includes a PGP signature. It is not entirely clear from the message what BIP 100 entails. However, the author's focus is on the process of miner voting and the timeline for publication. The author also provides links to their website and Keybase profile.
